bibl.editor: Surgeon General Joseph K. Barnes, United States Army

wounds and injuries of the head
gunshot contusions of the cranial bones
gunshot fractures of the external table of the cranium alone
fractures of the external wall of the frontal sinus
conoidal musket ball fractured external orbital process of frontal bone

revisionDesc.change: additional proofing of transcription and encoding, edited and added keyword terms

case text extracted and transformed from larger file
initial checking of OCR text against PDF; encoded

body.p: CASE.—Private John Miller, Co. I, 12th New Jersey Volunteers, aged 45 years, was wounded at the battle of the Wilderness, Virginia, May 6th, 1864, by a conoidal musket ball which fractured the external orbital process of the frontal bone. He was admitted to the hospital of the 2d division, Second Corps, and thence conveyed to the Mount Pleasant Hospital, Washington, where he was admitted on May 29th, 1864. Death resulted on the 22d of June.
